section.title: Use Content-Encoding metadata
section.paragraph: When you create an object or update its metadata, you can optionally set the Content-Encoding metadata. This metadata enables you to indicate that the object content is compressed without losing the identity of the underlying media type (Content-Type) of the file, such as a video.
This example assigns an attachment type to the Content-Encoding header that indicates how the file is downloaded:
section.literal_block: PUT /<api version>/<account>/<container>/<object> HTTP/1.1 Host: storage.clouddrive.com X-Auth-Token: eaaafd18-0fed-4b3a-81b4-663c99ec1cbb Content-Type: video/mp4 Content-Encoding: gzip
